history.content: Putting Spring 2021 instead of Spring 2022 as your expected graduation date will give you a lot more interviews. There are no downsides, and if you decide not to graduate early you can tell your recruiter once working and they can make it so instead of trying for a return full time offer you try for a return intern offer. I did this at Facebook.

children.subject: So basically if facebook rejects me for full time offer, can I say something like “uh actually just kidding I don’t wanna graduate early now. I want to apply for the summer intern position”, and try applying full time as a new grad again next year?

I believe most places wont allow you to apply full time and for internship at the same time, but you could apply full time this summer, get rejected and apply for full time next summer as well. 

my understanding is the easiest way to get a Facebook, Amazon, Apple, or Google is to intern there and then get a full time conversion. Netflix doesn't hire interns, new grads, or junior software engineers.

Thanks for the answer. If I fail the new grad 2021 interview (which is rather likely because I haven’t done much leetcode), can I take another year of class and apply to FB next year as new grad 2022 or as Intern for 2021 summer?

history.content: So Facebook and other big companies are starting full time recruitment. I’ve take enough classes to graduate Spring 2021, but I’m normally supposed to graduate Spring 2022. I want to try to apply this year, and if I get an offer at FAANG it would be nice and I can graduate early. Is there any drawback of me applying this year? If I fail, is it gonna negatively impact my next application?
history.subject: Is there any drawbacks for applying FAANG early?
